characters: THANK YOU TO THE FOLLOWING ARTISTS AND GALLERIES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snow falls gently on the grounds.  In the background, a dignified eighteenth-century classroom building is softly lit by outdoor lights.  A single light, on the second floor, is still burning.  The opening credits continue to be assembled randomly, sans anagrams. Ben Kingsley River Phoenix David Strathairn

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four six nine nine four zero two, transfer to five three zero one one three eight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The forty-column display is connected to the United States Treasury Department, and shows the transaction taking place. $25,000.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did we just do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Republican party just made a generous donation to the Black Panthers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera pans across the terminal, the dial telephone resting in the acoustic coupler modem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Far out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's next?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see... oooh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty shuffles through some printouts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard Nixon's personal chequing account is in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera continues to pan around the late-sixties equipment in the room, looking up to the huge nine-track tape drive.  Empty chinese food boxes litter the room - something that hasn't changed among hackers in thirty years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooo, this is a challenge.  Marty, we have to find somebody truly worthy to give his money to.  How about... the National Association to Legalize Marijuana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, how much should he give?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a generous man.  I'd say... all he's got!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cosmo thinks for a split second, and changes his tone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty, you are sure we will not get into trouble for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cosmo!  Trust me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police officers drive slowly through the snow, and listen to instructions on the radio. INT. COMPUTER ROOM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Posit.  The Phone Company has too much money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, good one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Consequence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, they're corrupt.  Result?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The system perpetuates itself at the expense of the people.  Conclusion?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma Bell needs to donate some money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to change the world, Marty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wish we could get course credit for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gawsh!  You got it.  You want some food?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cosmo swivels around, and holds out a coin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loser goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cosmo hides the coin in one of his hands, and makes it look pretty obvious which one.  He holds out both fists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never lose!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He indicates Cosmo's left hand.  Cosmo dramatically unfolds it, revealing no coin. Marty Groans.  Cosmo chuckles.  Marty starts to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pepperoni pizza, please.  Shaken, not stirred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Power to the people, Cos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Power to the people, Marty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both make half hearted fist gestures.  Marty exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One cannot trust anybody these days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty emerges from the front door and walks off into the snowy night.  He climbs into his snow-encrusted microbus, but it won't start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty notices the flashing red police lights through the snow on his windows.  He rolls down a window and watches as police and trenchcoated men pull up and run into the building. INT. COMPUTER ROOM. Cosmo is working at the terminal.  He hears a noise.  He gets up and walks across to the window.  Marty is down below, trying to signal Cosmo but it's too late.  The police grab Cosmo and pull him away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty!  Marty!  Wait!  Wait!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cosmo struggles, kicking out a window pane. Marty runs off into the night.  The snow turns into static on a TV screen. INT. SNEAKER VAN.  PRESENT DAY (1992).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin?  Martin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donald Crease is trying to wake up a now-older Marty Bishop.  He shakes his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin?  Martin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop wakes up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are we doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl's in position on the fire escape. Mother's in the cable vault.  Whistler is reading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whistler reads.  In braille. A noise sounds. Whistler quickly puts away what he was reading.  It's the braille edition of Playboy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's with the lobby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still just the one guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, Mother, try the ones coming off the blue trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop looks out the van through binoculars, across the street and into a building.  A security guard looks around. More noises sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmmm, nope.  Try the ones coming off the white trunk, Mother, these don't sound right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop looks down, to a manhole where Mother is working. More tones sound. EXT. MANHOLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They even got photos of the guy leaving the embassy through the back service entrance. Hey Crease, you on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you still in CIA in '72?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep, why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you know the deputy director of planning was down in Managua, Nicaragua the day before the earthquake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now what are you saying, the CIA caused the Managua earthquake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I can't prove it... but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crease hangs up his mic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't talk to that guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tones continue to sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on, Mother, go back one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tone we just heard sounds again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bingo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Securing bridge clips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother attaches the clips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Preparing to sever master alarm circuit. Five... four...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lone security guard is watching television.  A security panel in the distance briefly flashes a red light, which the guard barely notices before it's "green" again.  He goes on watching television. EXT. STREET.  NIGHT. Bishop and Crease leave the van and run across the street.  The building is a large bank.  They reach the fire escape where Carl is stationed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wouldn't believe what I had to go through just to get a safe deposit box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera pans across dozens of boxes.  There is a loud, ominous ticking.  Box 589 begins smoking. INT. SECURITY STATION. An alarm sounds.  The security guard is startled and knocks the TV off the counter. INT. FIRE ESCAPE DOOR. Carl, Bishop, and Crease enter the building through the fire escape. INT. SECURITY STATION. The security guard frantically searches through a procedure manual. INT. BANK FLOOR. The three run down through the main customer lobby of the bank. Bishop falls trying to jump the counter. Crease helps him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit!  We're getting too old for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The security guard gets on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lifeguard Security.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I got a fire at Centurion Bank!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, we've got the alarm.  Are there any secondary indications?  Smoke, or flame?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The security guard looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sm... uh, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably a false alarm.  We've been getting them in your area all night.  See if it resets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh man, I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three reach a small room and start looking behind panels. They come to one with a lot of wires behind it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sure you know which one to cut?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!  The alarm's always the green one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He cuts a wire.  All the lights go out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, man, I'm not waiting any longer, I'm calling the fire...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The alarm abruptly stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  It uh... stopped.  Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, no problem.  And, uh, son...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The "Security Chief" is actually Whistler, back in the van!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whistler gets back on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All yours, Bish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crease is now hacking at a bank terminal.  Bishop looks on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So.  How much do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A teller carefully places ten-thousand dollar wads of money in a briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eighty thousand.  Ninety thousand.  One hundred thousand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I ask why you're closing your account with us today, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I just had this weird feeling that my money wasn't safe here anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop walks off, past a security guard and up the stairs and into a boardroom overlooking the bank floor. Several executives are waiting for him.  He puts the briefcase down on the table and starts dramatically slapping ten-thousand dollar wads of money down in front of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, your communication lines are vulnerable, your fire exits need to be monitored, your rent-a-cops are a tad undertrained.  Outside of that everything seems to be just fine. You'll be getting our full report and analysis in a few days but first, who's got my cheque?

dialogues.speaker: A FEW MINUTES LATER.
dialogues.text: A cheque is carefully typed out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, people hire you to break into their places to make sure no one can break into their places?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a living.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a very good one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives Bishop the cheque.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop leaves with his cheque. EXT. STREET.  DAY. Two guys watch Bishop from a parked car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah.  It's him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl hurriedly marches across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's got the report for the bank sneak?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to type it up later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We haven't paid the typist since January, so it's either me or Whistler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better Whistler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got customers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Expensive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look busy, guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop straightens his tie and takes off to the waiting room. INT. WAITING ROOM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Bishop!  Dick Gordon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He and Bishop shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buddy Wallace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop and Wallace shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've heard a lot of great things about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're all true!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Carl.  Uh, gentlemen, why don't we go to the conference room, and you can tell us how we can help you, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They move to the conference room.  Bishop motions for them to have a seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, here uh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before we begin, uh, there's something we'd like to clear up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most firms of this type are staffed with ex-law enforcement types, but your team, it's, uh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop smiles and finishes his sentence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know... kind of different.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop is caught off guard as Wallace finally speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darren Roskow.  Also known as "Mother".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera pans across to Mother working on an inspecific piece of equipment.  Wallace continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eighteen months at Dannemora for breaking and entering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, he was framed.  He's got the best hands in the business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl Arbogast.  Age nineteen.  Caught breaking into the Oakland City School District computer to change his grades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know!  We're the ones who caught him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irwin Emery.  Also known as "Whistler."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, I know.  He had some little problem with the phone company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sixty-two counts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, you want law enforcement?  How about Donald Crease?  Twenty-two year veteran of the CIA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terminated!  1987.  Why was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, I think maybe a personality conflict.  Who are you guys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax, Marty!  We have to check on these things, it's just that everybody on your team has had some sort of problem in their past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then there's Martin Bishop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An uncomfortably pregnant pause.  Finally Wallace reveals an empty file folder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't seem to have a past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah.  Sorry to waste your time, gentlemen.  I don't work for the government.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon walks up to Bishop and shows his ID.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: National Security Agency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah.  You're the guys I hear breathing on the other end of my phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's the FBI.  We're not chartered for domestic surveillance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I see.  You just overthrow governments. Set up friendly dictators.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's the CIA.  We protect our government's communications, we try to break the other fella's codes.  We're the good guys, Marty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee, I can't tell you what a relief that is, Dick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, that's enough.  Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wallace and Gordon get up to leave.  Wallace leaves immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you change your mind, call us at this number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon hands Bishop a wrinkled scrap of paper with a number hastily scribbled on it.  He looks Bishop straight in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Brice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop looks up at him, surprised.  Gordon looks back, with a "no shit" look on his face. Gordon leaves.  Bishop unfolds the paper.  It's a "Wanted" poster for Martin Brice - now Martin Bishop - with his picture from 1969. EXT. STREET.  DAY. Martin Bishop parks his car and crosses the street.  A panhandler gets his attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spare a quarter?  Help me out?  The government's taken away my home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk to him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop tosses him a coin. INT. NSA OFFICE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well!  If it isn't Robin Hood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I could have joined the NSA.  But I found out my parents were married!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wallace is visibly upset by this.  Gordon stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, heyheyhey, we're all friends here, alright?  Easy, easy. Want some coffee or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buddy, is that Janek's file?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wallace puts down a file folder and opens it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Janek's file.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a mathematician, named Dr. Gunter Janek. Works at a think tank called the Coolidge Institute. Specializes in large number theory, prime numbers, factoring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cryptography.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very good!  Last month, the good doctor gets a grant, three hundred eighty thousand dollars, way out of profile for a guy like that.  It's our job to be curious, so we traced the money.  Guess where it comes from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you're not going to say Russia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh.  Give me a break.  We won, they lost, you know? It's been in a couple of papers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, we still spy on them, they still spy on us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We intercepted a fax last week.  Here. They're making some kind of box. A little black box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The project is called "Setec Astronomy"... We don't know what "Setec" stands for...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Security Technology...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sensor Techniques, who knows.  Anyway it may mean nothing, or it may be something, we need to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And your job is to find that little black box and let us take a look at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  No way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Marty, we don't have a lot of choice here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By law, we're not allowed or equipped to do this kind of operation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, then get the FBI.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wallace chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, right.  FBI.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FBI can't work for us without approval from a congressional oversight committee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankly, because we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop cuts him off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty, sit down, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon and Bishop sit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankly, because it's kind of illegal. You've managed to stay underground for more than twenty years, that tells us you know how not to get caught.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We know you can keep your mouth shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The job pays $175,000, payable on delivery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can... distribute it among the poor if you like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We also clean up your record.  Quash the outstanding warrant for your arrest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your pal Cosmo got twelve years.  That was without "Flight to evade prosecution."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We all know what happened to him in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop pauses uneasily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if I say no?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What good would you do anybody in prison?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe this.  You lied to us all these years! Even lied to us about your name!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, okay?  I'm sorry fellas, I'm sorry, but when you're wanted by the feds, you don't exactly go around telling everybody about it, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are not "everybody", Martin, we are your partners, you tell us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.  Exactly why was it you had to leave the CIA?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a foul look on his face, Crease turns his back on Bishop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We all have our little secrets, don't we? Look, you guys have a decision to make. This is not a test, the penetration is live, the target is unaware.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sneaking a foreign intelligence service that might kill us to keep us out is not what we do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The probable level of security is very low. But if you guys don't want to take that chance just to keep me out of jail, fine, I understand, I'll do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Bish, I can't speak for the other guys, but I'm in it for the money, I don't care if you go to jail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me neither.  I'm in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... could we maybe just go back to the "they might kill us" part?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother, if I thought that was likely to happen, I wouldn't bring this to you.  But there is a risk!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it pays $175,000!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys will be chalk outlines without me. All right, what do we need?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crease low-fives Whistler on his way back to the group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, we start with a very light surveillance, level three, first sign of babysitters, we back off.  Now this guy's giving a lecture tomorrow at UC, in the afternoon, I'm going to be there and checking him out.  Okay?  Any questions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one has any questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, let's do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone gets up and starts to go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the lecture, do you want to take Whistler, or do you want me to go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, no, no, that's okay, I thought I'd ask Liz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone stops in their tracks and turns around. Bishop notices after a few seconds and looks up. EXT. MUSIC CONSERVATORY.  DAY. Piano music plays in the background.  Children file across a grass quadrangle. INT. MUSIC CONSERVATORY. Liz is supervising a young student, who is playing brilliantly. The girl notices Bishop approaching and stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sort of an old friend. Practice!  Practice, practice!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl giggles and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not getting back together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I say anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here on business, Liz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes around the room and starts collecting music from the racks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop, you don't have a business.  You have a club!  A boy's club.  You have a little club house, you probably have a secret handshake...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz, I need your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will not be dragged back into your world. I have a new group of gifted children now and I like the fact that they're under thirty.  Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a mathematician named Gunter Janek. You know him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz is now shooing Bishop out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've read him.  Now go away!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well he's giving a master's lecture at 3:30... now I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How nice for him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shuts the door, with Bishop behind. Bishop opens the door and comes back in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I'd buy you dinner after.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not going out with you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't a date, dummy, this is a scientific exploration, a tutorial.  I need you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz looks at him doubtfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To explain it to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Read a book!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've found me, Liz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops in her tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The government found me.  They offered me a deal.  If I take their offer, they clear my record and I can get my name back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and I are not getting back together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, don't flatter yourself!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pick me up at 3.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gunter Janek is giving his lecture.  He is covered with cryptographic and mathematical figures from an overhead projector.  He exudes confidence in his subject matter; he clearly has a talent for putting on a presentation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While the number field sieve is the best method currently known, there exists an intriguing possibility for a far more elegant approach...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop and Liz watch as he continues his lecture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This guy's good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and hence contained in a single cyclotomic field. Using the Arden map, we might introduce homomorphisms for the principal orders within each of these fields...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You seeing anybody?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sh. This isn't just about large number theory, it's about cryptography.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  You mean codes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean unbreakable codes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...It would be a breakthrough of gaussian proportions and allow us to acquire the solution in a dramatically more efficient manner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you seeing anybody?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So far, no one has been able to accomplish such constructions... yet.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Janek is now discussing his ideas with attendees over a buffet table, with all the confidence and showmanship of his lecture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The numbers are so unbelievably big, that all the computers in the world could not break them down.  But maybe... just maybe... there's a shortcut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll bet you anything he's found it.  If he has, you're in over your head.  I'll get my coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes to get her coat.  Someone else notices Bishop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop acknowledges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin, how wonderful to see you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Greg, how are you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it not fabulous?  Today I can, in public, come and learn your scientists' new secrets! Alas, I did not understand one bit what he was talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop is visibly distracted, but it's phoney - he's trying to get Greg to look the other way.  Greg doesn't, and notices Liz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least ... Goodness, can it be? Elizabeth!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, right... she's dying to talk to you too, Greg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me.  Elizabeth... Elizabeth!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Greg!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth and Martin.  My heart leaps like gazelle to see you back together again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg helps her with her coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell it to stop leaping, we are not back together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah. Oh, what a pity.  Wait, I have smashing idea.  Martin! Martin!  Kiev String Quartet plays at the consulate on thursday night, you will be my guests!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really, Greg, I wouldn't know how to repay you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha ha.  Martin, now that our countries are such good friends, perhaps you will finally be able to do occasional favor for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregor, you are shameless!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see you thursday night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg hands Bishop a card - which he's scribbled something on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, new title.  Cultural attache.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The card reads: Commonwealth of Independent States Consulate General Gregor Ivanovich Cultural Attache

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unbelievable!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm.  Last few years it's been very confusing for people in my line of work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll bet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg excuses himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care what anyone says about the New World Order.  I don't trust that guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who, Greg?  Ah, he's harmless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop notices that a woman is whispering in Janek's ear.  He stops playing the crowd in mid-sentence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you'll excuse me, I have some work...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to follow him, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz, I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.  I'll get a cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I call you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just be careful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leaves.  So does Janek. EXT. SNEAKER VAN.  NIGHT. Bishop walks up to the van, which is on the top floor of a parkade across the street from the building the sneakers have staked out.  He gets in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janek just got in the elevator.  Going up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We will be ready for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's the audio?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.  Mother's pretty close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through binoculars, Bishop sees Mother on a window-washer's platform just under Janek's office. Janek enters the office and turns on the lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's just wearing FOUR safety belts this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, no parachute?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alrighty, entry and lights on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Describe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like a work room.  You got yourself a bench with a soldering gun, two spools of wire and a magnifying lamp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh.  Sounds like they're making something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And a desk... telephone... lamp... answering machine... jar of pencils... but no little black box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's got to be there somewhere, what's he doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's logging on the computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop now looks through the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, this is good.  He's going to type in his password, we're going to get a clear shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A knock on Janek's door.  Janek answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Dr. Rhyzkov.  Good evening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get an ID on Dr. Rhyzkov.  She was with him at the lecture this afternoon and she was trying to tell him something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhyzkov immediately starts making an erotic move on Janek... her panting and moaning re-engages the attention of the sneakers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Gunter... let's do what we did in Mexico City... Oh Gunter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know you could do THAT in Mexico City.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Bishop, do you mind if I take a look?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grow up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhyzkov continues loudly panting and moaning. Crease taps on Bishop's shoulder and whispers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop grudgingly obliges. Janek pushes her away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elena, really!  I must finish my work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, back to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope, here we go, now we're going to get our password.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhyzkov rubs Janek's shoulders as he types in his password, inconveniently blocking the view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I leave message here on service but you do not call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, get out of the way, get ou... she's in the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhyzkov starts kissing Janek's neck, Janek bends away, resisting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop leaves the camera in disgust.  Carl leaps to replace him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, it's just I have this work...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhyzkov opens her blouse, revealing a legendarily well-supported pair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll give you something to work, baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is too much for Janek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, just for a little while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janek takes off his jacket and they kiss.  She closes the blinds.  The blinds crumple as Janek throws her against them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Gunter!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scene we just witnessed is now being replayed on video.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe there's a frame or two where she doesn't block it. I'll blow it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Risekoff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor Elena REESHkov.  Visiting professor from Czechoslovakia. Senior research fellow in Astrophysics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bingo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Setec Astronomy.  Whatever that is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, Mother blows up the video image as best he can.  It's a close up of Janek entering his password, with Rhyzkov partially in the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like the H.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do you get H?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right there next to the L.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, come on, do it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: H isn't next to the L.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then J!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys, do it again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother rewinds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, that's definitely W G.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Defintely not.  That's a V.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's in the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fellas, Janek's little black box is on his desk between the pencil jar and the lamp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, Whistler, I hate to tell you this, but you're blind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Play the tape back again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't even see anything!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't look, listen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whistler strikes a tuning fork.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Play it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I leave message here on service but you do not...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got a service.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They zoom in on the answering machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he need an answering machine for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's our little black box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop is being fitted with a hidden microphone and earpiece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, boss.  This LTX-71 concealable mic is part of the same system that NASA used when they faked the Apollo moon landings.  The astronauts broadcast around the world from a soundstage at Norton Air Force Base in San Bernardino, California, so if it worked for them, it shouldn't give us too many problems.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl, posing as a delivery driver, is quietly arguing with the desk clerk.  Bishop interrupts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Did my wife drop the cake off for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, what cake? There's no cake back here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surprise party for Marsha on the second floor.  She was supposed to have dropped a cake off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know anything about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A horn honks outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There she is, late as usual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop hurries outside. The clerk continues arguing with Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well it states right here very clearly that I am to deliver 36 boxes of Liquid Drano to this here address.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I don't care what that says.  If you're not on the list, you can't get in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I might lose my job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not my problem, kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop returns with a large box and many colorful balloons.  He stands at a security gate beside the front desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you buzz me in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clerk is too busy arguing with Carl.  He waves Bishop off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey just buzz it, I can't reach my card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait one minute...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clerk goes on arguing with Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buzz it, okay? We're late for a party on the second floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop, getting nowhere, raises his voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Push the goddamn buzzer, will ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clerk buzzes Bishop in.  Bishop steps through the gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop emerges from the elevator.  He discards the balloons and pulls his briefcase out of the cake box - there's no cake.  He reaches Janek's office door.  It has a digital keypad lock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anybody remember how to defeat an electronic keypad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't even joke about that, Martin.  Those things are impossible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think I'm joking?  Looks like they just put it in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh boy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, maybe this might help.  An old buddy of mine that was in Desert Storm sent it to me.  Of course, he was on the other side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands Crease a manual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Crease, there's got to be a way around these things!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, all right.  This might work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop listens carefully to Crease's detailed and lengthy instructions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... yeah... above... yeah... right... uh huh... uh huh... yeah... right... yeah... Okay.  I'll give it a shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop kicks the door open with one good boot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That worked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop enters the office.  He looks out the window to see the van parked across the street on the parkade.  He goes to the answering machine, and opens it up.  There, inside, is the Little Black Box.  He puts the entire thing in his briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Dr. Rhyzkov enters the room and turns on the lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gunter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sees Bishop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God, no.  Hi, nice to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lab is closed.  Excuse me, I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop shuts the door. He grabs her and puts his hand over her mouth so she can't scream.  The sneakers her her muffled cries over the radio. INT. SNEAKER VAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Battle Stations!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whistler, monitor the audio.  Grab the mic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  I'm going to remove my hand, now please do not scream.  I promise nothing is going to happen to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He removes his hand, she runs across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who... who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop doesn't know what to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a P.I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a private investigator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a private investigator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But why?  Who hired you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop still doesn't have an answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who HIRED you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Janek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is not Mrs. Janek!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crease is becoming exasperated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got us stumped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah?  Who do you think paid for your little love jaunt to Mexico City?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhyzkov is utterly horrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Velma.  Velma Janek.  She lives in Montreal where she handles her family's real estate holdings.  Vast real estate holdings. Farms, banks, shopping malls.  Two shopping malls. She supports Gunter but figured he was cheating on her and that's why she hired me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bastard liar!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She utters a few Czech swearwords and starts for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll kill him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop stops her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nonononono, get a hold of yourself, Dr. Rhyzkov.  Get a hold of yourself!  Mm mm! Now what you gotta do is you gotta not tell him you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you weren't here, we didn't talk.  You don't know me.  You don't know anything about a wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh!  You just give me one good reason why!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, I'll give you a reason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer from the sneakers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll give you a really good reason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just what she would want you to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just what she would want you to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just what she'd want you to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, sometimes I don't understand myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits her down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, look, I might lose my license for this.  My client is a vindictive, bitter woman.  She's been withholding marital favors from Gunter for many many years, and now she's out to ruin him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she's using you to get to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she's using y... uh, me... to get to h... you.  I know that's confusing, but don't you see what's happening here, you and me, we're just pawns in this ugly little game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you love him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you love him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you love him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop looks confused.  Nothing else is coming over the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you really love him, then just keep on loving him, and never let him know that you know what he thinks you don't know, you know.  You know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And give him head whenever he wants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crease cracks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And give him he... help.  Be a beacon in his sad and lonely life.  Can you do that for Gunter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, yes, I can. I can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  Now get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhyzkov kisses him on the cheek and leaves, sobbing quietly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give him head?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be a beacon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They crack up laughing. INT. MARTIN BISHOP & ASSOCIATES.  NIGHT. The offices are lit up as if for Christmas.  The guys are partying and celebrating.  Don Crease has brought his wife and young daughter.  Liz dances with all the sneakers.  Including Whistler.  Except Bishop.  Mother is boring Mrs. Crease with one of his conspiracy stories.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the key meeting took place July 1, 1958, when the Air Force brought the space visitor to the White House for an interview with President Eisenhower.  And Ike said, hey, look, give us your technology, and we'll give you all the cow lips you want. So that's when...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, don't listen to this man.  He's certifiable.

dialogues.text: Your husband knows about cattle mutilations, he's ex-CIA!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's touched!

dialogues.text: He knows the government's been suppressing for years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now at a banquet table, Carl has just finished hearing the story of Marty and Cosmo's exploits in the 60's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One thing I don't get, though, is you and Cosmo were taking all these chances, all these big chances, I mean, what for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were young.  And there was a war on.  It was a good way to meet girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll bet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come you didn't get caught?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I went out for pizza.  Then I went to Canada.  I was lucky, he wasn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he ever forgive you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope so.  He died in prison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A somber silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what are you guys going to do with your share of the money? Don?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we have never been to Europe, together, and we are going.  Madrid, Lisbon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Athens, oh and Scotland...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Tahiti..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you know, I've never actually had a really cool car that I could fit comfortably into.  So I think I'm going to buy me a Winnebago.  With a big kitchen... waterbed... big kitchen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl has been inhaling helium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to have a deep relationship with a beautiful woman who melts from the very first time our eyes meet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not getting paid that much, Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you know, someone like Liz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're definitely not getting paid that much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone oooohs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz just taps Bishop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whistler?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, peace on earth, good will toward men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hear hear.

dialogues.speaker: LATER.
dialogues.text: Some of the sneakers are playing Scrabble.  Bishop adds "S" and "Y" to "CRUNCH".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not a word!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scrunchy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scrunchy's not a word.  Scrunchy is not a word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scrunchy.  Scrunchy is a word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since when?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what happens to your face?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, please.  It's not a word!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right now your face is scrunchy.  You are scrunchy, so that is a word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, we're gonna take it as a word for the time being...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, Whistler is examining (as best a blind person can) the little black box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does it say where this is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on a second here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl turns on a magnifying lamp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "System Out."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crease notices what they are doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys, I really think you should leave that thing alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know.  I just wanted to see something, don't worry, Don. How do you spell Setec?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: S.E.T.E.C.  Setec. Special... Extraterrestrial?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earthling Counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, Liz is telling a story over the Scrabble game, and Bishop is pondering over the letters. Apparently it's his turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Setec...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Setec Astronomy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just love it when a man says that to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Setec doesn't mean anything.  Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pours the scrabble pieces onto the table and puts aside the board.  He forms the words "SETEC ASTRONOMY" from scrabble pieces.  Then he starts making anagrams from those letters. Meanwhile, Carl and Whistler are poring intently over the Little Black Box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm.  Carl... get me some cable... and an I/O interface please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl obliges.  Meanwhile, Bishop has come up with the anagram: MONTEREYS COAST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Montereys Coast.  Does Montereys Coast mean anything, you guys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whistler keeps working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl.... get the diagnostics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz and Bishop find another: MY SOCRATES NOTE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about "My Socrates Note?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-uh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They find another: COOTYS RAT SEMEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother probes different parts of the little black box with a test probe, and Whistler's Braille Terminal gives him a rapid readout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh.  Got it.  Move to another one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scrabble letters start resolving into: TOO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmm hmm.  Give me another one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whistler's Braille Terminal rattles away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay in that quadrant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scrabble letters now say TOO MANY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's kind of like the same thing.  Try another quadrant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something comes up on the monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa.  What was that?  Go back one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The monitor fills with data.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy cow!  What the hell is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Data streams across the screen. Now the scrabble letters say, TOO MANY SECRETS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too many secrets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bish, I think you'd better come over here. Carl, you got your little black book?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me the number for something impossible to access.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about this: Federal Reserve Transfer Node, Culpepper Virginia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure, good luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 900 billion a day go through there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'll do.  Punch it in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  You won't get in.  It's encrypted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Encrypted text fills the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother, that last contact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The encrypted text slowly resolves into plain text.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at this, boys.  Anybody want to shut down the Federal Reserve?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, hey hey, don't screw around with that thing. You...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What else have you got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The national power grid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whistler chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we come... Mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This time a power grid map of the northeastern United States appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow... unbelievable!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anybody want to black out New England? Carl, what else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Air Traffic Control System.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scrambled data comes back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother probes the box.  An Air Traffic Control map of the Bay Area comes up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is this possible?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crytpography systems are based on mathematical problems so complex they cannot be solved without a key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janek must have figured out a way to solve those problems without the key, and he hard wired it into that chip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anybody want to crash a couple of passenger jets?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said turn it off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn it off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop turns it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So it's a code breaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  It's THE code breaker.  No more secrets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, you and Melissa get your things.

dialogues.speaker: A MINUTE LATER.
dialogues.text: Crease shows his wife and sleeping child to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Night-night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Night-night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shuts the door behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What time is the handoff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nine.  AM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, between now and then we are going to institute some security around here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crease looks for his long-disused sidearm.  He straps it on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooo oo oo, this is where I get off.  Nice to see you again, guys.  I'm out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts to leave, but Crease stops her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't take this personally, Liz, but you were the only one who knew Martin's secret, and somebody talked.  So make yourself comfortable, we're all staying right here tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I'm getting my bag. And I'm leaving. So relax, Crease.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crease stops her again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll relax when we get that damn thing out of here. Until then, you stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There isn't a government on this planet that wouldn't kill us all for that thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop gets up and walks over to Liz to break the bad news to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl?  Hit the alarm.  Whistler, let's unplug that thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother, lock everything down.  Doors and windows.  Then kill the lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for the trust, fellows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time passes.  Bishop paces.  Crease loads his revolver. The others sleep.  Fade to black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really enjoyed sleeping with all you guys. Take care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys all say goodbye.  Bishop helps her with her coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope the handoff goes well.  I'd hate for you to have something new to run from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin?  It's time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He packs up the box. EXT. STREET.  DAY. Bishop parks his car on a street by the Bay, in the shadow of the Golden Gate Bridge.  Wallace and Gordon are waiting for him at a sidewalk cafe table.  Crease waits at the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Morning!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any problems?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want a cappucino?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop hands over the box.  Gordon and Wallace look inside. Gordon smiles broadly. Meanwhile, Crease notices something on the front page of the newspaper: MATHEMATICIAN KILLED.  MURDER, ARSON SUSPECTED. The face in the picture is Janek's.  Crease realizes something horrible.  Ominous music starts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got his cheque?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wallace opens a briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Martin!  Telephone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He waves a cellphone dramatically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a minute!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's your MOTHER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop looks back at Gordon and Wallace, whose smiles have disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's, uh... she's old.  Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes back to the car without the box or any cheque.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in the car!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't get the money!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon starts after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They get in the car and drive off like a shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing?  I didn't get the money!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janek's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They killed him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The NSA doesn't kill people, Martin.   Who are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said it last night, there isn't a government on earth that wouldn't kill for that thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not ours!  Who were those guys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's one way to find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs a star-wars left turn, cutting off another driver. They arrive at the building where Wallace and Gordon's office was.  "Was" being the proper word: it has been demolished. A panhandler approaches the car, cup held out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They took away my home.  Help me out?  The government took away my home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop looks dejectedly out the window to the rainy city. Behind him, Crease paces busily.  He's on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me you can't do it, because I know you can. And don't tell me you won't do it because I've got to have it. Damnit, I need to know!  And I need to know now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, guys, interesting.  That federal building?  It's been scheduled for demolition since August.  It housed the Federal Trade Commission and the Department of Agriculture. It's been vacant for a month.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The NSA never had an office in San Francisco!  Their West Coast operations are run out of Los Angeles!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God.  Yeah, thanks. Janek's grant is from the NSA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws the phone across the room and bears down on Bishop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could you be so goddamned stupid?  Two guys show up, say they're government and you just buy it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They probably were government.  Just not ours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop looks at the card Greg gave him after the lecture and ponders whether to call him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody pack up whatever you can.  This place isn't safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop goes to his desk and gets a 38 special.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think you're doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to a concert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The string quartet plays masterfully to an intimate, formally dressed audience. Greg has a lovely young date with him.  Bishop sneaks up behind Greg and pokes the revolver into his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin, have you lost your mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My darling, would you excuse me for a moment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They leave. INT. UNDERGROUND SWIMMING POOL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me back Janek's box, Greg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin, I don't have it.  Now, you must believe me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You used me, you set me up, Greg, no I do not believe you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had nothing to do with this Janek business.  Not for lack of trying, mind you. Your codes are entirely different from ours. We've never had any luck in breaking them. So Lord knows I wanted that box.  But we didn't take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop puts the gun away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then who did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I will tell you now I cannot tell you in this building.  Do you understand?  Come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts back up the stairs.  Bishop doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin.  You must trust me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg is showing Bishop a spy scrapbook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg flips the page.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg says something in Russian to his driver and flips again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg puts the book away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am afraid these books are not as current as they used to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys still keep tabs on all our agents, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are just the ones we thought we could turn.  You know, sexual problems... financial troubles...  then we had financial troubles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By now Greg is flipping through another book.  Bishop stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's him.  The older guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The picture is a clear profile of Buddy Wallace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A loathsome man named Buddy DeVries.  A.K.A. Buddy Weber, Buddy Wallace...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wallace.  That's him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hm.  We tried to recruit him in '83. Drinking problem, married three times.  Left the NSA four years ago...  Oh my.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg abruptly slams the book closed.  He is as white as a sheet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg just looks grim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You disappeared once before, my friend.  I suggest you do it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?  Who's he working for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A police siren sounds behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your FBI is such a pain in the ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says something in Russian to the driver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's he working for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car pulls over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin, I can offer you asylum inside this car. Technically it's part of the consulate. Do you wish our protection?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  Who is Wallace working for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone taps on the window.  It rolls down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Bishop?  My name is Special Agent Vestrop, FBI. Please, step out of the vehicle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you wish our protection?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Bishop, get out of the vehicle now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop starts to get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't know who to trust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop exits the car.  It turns out that they are in a tunnel. Mr. Bishop, step over here please. Hands on the wall, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop complies.  The agent frisks him, and finds Bishop's handgun.  We notice that the agent is wearing gloves...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this loaded?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The agent puts on a glove, takes Bishop's gun from the other agent, aims it into the car, and executes Greg. Greg's driver gets out of the car and runs for it, and he is shot in the back. He slowly turns around and carefully leaves the weapon on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too many secrets!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buddy Wallace emerges from the "FBI" car and knocks Bishop unconscious with a single blow.  Fade to black. INT. AUTO TRUNK. (Trivia nuts: the car's license plate is California 2EAK0 Bishop regains consciousness in the trunk of a car.  A recurring noise is heard.  He strikes a match so he can see.  He squirms around to no avail.  He hears other noises and just lies there. Finally the car stops, and someone gets out.  The trunk opens, and Buddy Wallace is shining a flashlight in Bishop's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wallace knocks him out again. INT. COSMO'S OFFICE. Bishop regains consciousness in an ultra-modern, well-appointed office suite.  With an aquarium full of exotic fish, and a Cray supercomputer Cosmo is waiting in the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cosmo steps out of the shadows, so that his features can be discerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try aspirin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cosmo offers him a small jar of pills. He hides the jar in one of his hands, in the same magician's style that he hid that coin all those years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cosmo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cosmo reveals the jar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry if he hurt you.  I'm afraid Wallace doesn't like you very much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  You ought to have that guy checked for rabies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rabies occurs only in warm-blooded animals. Anyway, I couldn't have you talking to the Russians.  Five years ago, yes, we could trust them not to go running to the FBI, or if they did, we could trust the FBI not to believe them; today... we can't trust anybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell's going on here?  Cosmo, what... what happened?
