dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The world changed on us, Marty.  And without our help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cosmo smiles and motions to get up.  Both do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There I was in prison, and, one day I help a couple of nice older gentlemen make some free telephone calls. They turn out to be... let us say "good family men".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Organized crime?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heh.  Don't kid yourself.  It's not that organized. Anyway, they arranged for me to get an early release from my "unfortunate incarceration" and I began to perform a variety of services.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cosmo turns on a large monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For starters, I re-organized their entire financial operation.  Budgets, payroll, money laundering, you name it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cosmo demonstrates with a computer spreadsheet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the whole network is protected by a very powerful encryption system, so the government cannot read it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But if the feds get Janek's box...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cosmo switches off the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Disaster!  Therefore, we must have it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To protect the organization.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I don't buy it.  I know you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cosmo grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, it's good to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cosmo silently puts his finger to his mouth, "Shhh", and looks to the cieling.  He motions Bishop toward the Cray supercomputer's air-conditioned glass compartment. As they walk over to the Cray, Cosmo starts whispering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember how to change the world, Marty? Remember?  Did you ever get around to actually doing it?  No?  I guess not. Well, I think I can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter the Cray compartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cosmo continues aloud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with this country, Marty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop just looks dumb.  Both men sit down on the Cray's padded "seat".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Money.  You taught me that.  Evil defense contractors had it, noble causes did not. Politicians are bought and sold like so much chattel.  Our problems multiply.  Pollution, crime, drugs, poverty, disease, hunger, despair; we throw gobs of money at them! The problems always get worse.  Why is that? Because money's most powerful ability is to allow bad people to continue doing bad things at the expense of those who don't have it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I agree.  Now who did you say you were working for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's just my day job.  Listen, when I was in prison, I learned that everything in this world, including money, operates not on reality...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but the perception of reality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cosmo smiles broadly, sensing the old college banter coming back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Posit.  People think a bank might be financially shaky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Consequence.  People start to withdraw their money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Result.  Pretty soon it IS financially shaky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conclusion.  You can make banks fail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bzzzt!  I've already done that.  Maybe you've read about a few?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop puts on a "no shit?" look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think bigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stock market?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Currency market.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commodities market.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Small countries?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cosmo nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I might even be able to crash the whole damned system. Destroy all records of ownership.  Think of it, Marty.  No more rich people, no more poor people, everbody's the same, isn't that what we said we always wanted?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cos, you haven't gone crazy on me, have you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who else is going to change the world, Marty? Greenpeace?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ARE crazy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A disappointed Cosmo briskly leaves the compartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow, they will retrieve your fingerprints from the gun that killed the Russian consular officer.  The following day, those prints will be run through an FBI computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cosmo taps on a keyboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They will come up with a name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cosmo starts entering Bishop's real name, Martin Brice, into an FBI computer record.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin Brice!  My old and good friend who promised me we would not get in trouble and who I might add, did not.  And then they will check this database in Washington, D.C., which I'm now able to access, thanks to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now a screenful of random junk resolves into a login screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, no one knows where Martin Brice is, today.  But what if this indicated an alias?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cosmo types "Martin Bishop" into a "Known Aliases:" field, overtyping "None". Bishop is shaken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't... don't do it, Cos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try prison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cosmo hits "Enter" and then "Information Updated" appears in red on the screen. Bishop slumps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ciao.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buddy Wallace comes up behind Bishop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no, not the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dick Gordon is now also behind Bishop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just relax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon puts Bishop in a headlock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more secrets, Marty.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. SAN FRANCISCO STREET. DAWN.
dialogues.text: It's dawn atop one of San Francisco's famous slopes. Alcatraz Island lies in the distance.  A black car crests the hill and screeches to a halt.  Martin Bishop is thrown, half conscious, onto the street, and then the car takes off.  He painfully gets up, finds his bearings, and walks away. INT. APARTMENT BUILDING. Bishop knocks on the door of apartment 4B. INT. LIZ'S APARTMENT. Liz, wearing a bathrobe, answers the door.  She gasps at Bishop's condition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've had a bad night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really.  You look terrific.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look awful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz, who is not wearing any makeup and looks like she's just gotten out of bed, nevertheless looks stunning as always.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I should think so, considering what I've been through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They go to her bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you got hit over the head twice and got thrown out of a speeding car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Here, let me do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She cleans up the cut to his head.  It stings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.  I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop looks her in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They embrace mournfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The paper said that Greg was killed.  I called your number and someone else answered.  I didn't recognize the voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do this alone, Liz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop makes a phone call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to meet.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ'S APARTMENT. LATER.
dialogues.text: A television news show goes in-depth about Greg's murder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FBI says the fingerprints found in the embassy car match those taken from the office of a government researcher found murdered earlier this week in Palo Alto. The connection was made after a Bay Area radio station received an anonymous tip linking the two killings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'll bet it was anonymous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns off the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, it's time we call the authorities.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah.  Great.  Now that we're accessories to espionage and murder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the more reason to turn ourselves in now, while we can still cut a deal!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With what? We got bupkus! We turn ourselves in now, they'll give us twenty years in the electric chair!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I like it?  Goddamnit, I've got a family!  But we have no other choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, we do.  We make the call, but we make it our way. Unload the van.

dialogues.speaker: A FEW MINUTES LATER.
dialogues.text: The sneakers are turning Liz's apartment into an electronic command center.  She meekly holds the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.  Nice apartment.

dialogues.speaker: A FEW MORE MINUTES LATER.
dialogues.text: A map of the world is displayed on a computer screen. Lines start forming between different points.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to bounce this call through nine different relay stations throughout the world and off two satellites. It'll be the hardest trace they've ever heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother proudly shows off an impressive-looking pen register machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This'll measure stress in the voice of the person on the other end of the line.  Not as accurate as a polygraph, but for today's purposes it'll do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It becomes apparent that we've seen Whistler and Mother's little presentations through Liz's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unbelievable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop places Liz's phone handset in an acoustic coupler and dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fort Meade, Maryland.  Good afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try director of ops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhm, National Security Agency, director of operations please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What extension, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhm, sorry, I forget the number.  Uh, could I please have director of operations?  It's very important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What extension, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try research.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me research.  It's an emergency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need an extension or a name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Setec Astronomy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The operator is silent for a few seconds.  Her tone of voice changes dramatically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One moment, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A link on Whistler's phone connection display blinks. Weird noises in his headset signal him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've started the trace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A deep-voiced man comes on the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is this, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my dime, I'll ask the questions.  Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, let's say my name is... Mr. Abbott.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother's lie-detecting pen register wavers a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: True.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've made the second leg!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another link on Whistler's display blinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Abbott, are you interested in Setec Astronomy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm interested in all kinds of astronomy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother's pen register wiggles a little bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've got the satellite and Tokyo.  These guys are good!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to know if you're someone who can make a deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you deal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! True.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another link on Whistler's display blinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're across Transcom, you've got about twenty seconds, Bish!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I come in with what I know, can you guarantee my safety?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have the item?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crease shakes his head and mouths "No."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifteen seconds!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you guarantee my safety?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is the item?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you guarantee my safety?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five seconds!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I can guarantee your safety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pen register goes crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bish, he's lying!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang up, they've almost got us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's lying!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang up, Bish!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's lying, he's lying!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whistler gets up and blindy fumbles across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's got to be a way to cut a deal with those guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too late.  If we had the box, yes.  Without it, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So let's get this fricking thing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know where it is, remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did it sound like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've no idea at all where they took you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  They threw me in a trunk, drove around in circles. It could be a hundred miles away, it could be next door, it could be underground, it could be in a skyrise. Forget it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bish, what did it sound like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The road.  When you were in the trunk, what did the road sound like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I don't.... highway, a regular highway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, did you go over any speedbumps? Gravel?  How about a bridge?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridge.  Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four bridges in the Bay Area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was the Golden Gate fogged in last night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hear a foghorn?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scratch the Golden Gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That leaves three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did it sound like?  Did you go through a tunnel in the middle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not... no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scratch the Bay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well that leaves two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: San Mateo and Dunbarton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did it sound like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whistler, by now, has set up a musical synthesizer and is making noises with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whistler lowers the pitch of the noise a couple of notches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whistler lowers the noise again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was a recurring sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like seams in the concrete.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whistler adds a recurring thumping to the noise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But further apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whistler slows the thumping. Bishop's eyes light up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sneakers' van drives across a very long concrete bridge. The tire noises sound almost exactly like the noises Whistler synthesized earlier. INT. VAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bumps.  Rough ones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Railroad tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, a right on Anthrem and a left on eighty-four.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then what did you hear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cocktail party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We drove through what sounded... it sounded like a... cocktail party.  It was a chattering.  It was right at the end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.  Now we gotta look for a cocktail party on the other side of the railroad track.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, Carl, what's the exit where the railroad tracks are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crescent!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well then stay on Crescent, get off at the reservoir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a cocktail party at the reservoir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, yeah.  Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A busy chattering can be heard.  It *is* kind of like a cocktail party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was very good, Bish.  Remind me to make you an honorary blind person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the sneakers looking at hundreds, maybe thousands of geese on the bank of the reservoir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's this road go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nowhere.  Looks like it ends right around that hill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's behind the hill?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.  It's private property.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop realizes what this means.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Private!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sneakers hurry back into the van, and leave the geese behind them. SHORTLY AFTER. They arrive a couple of hundred yards from a big, modern building.  Carl looks around through binoculars.  A flag flies out front.  A corporate sign: PlayTronics The Future of Toys

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it.  It's a toy company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop takes the binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toy company my ass.  That's laser fencing. There's high voltage on the perimeter.  The whole building says "Go Away." It's Cosmo, I know it.  The toy company's a front. Mother, get the directional.  Carl, get the video.  Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: MINUTES LATER.
dialogues.text: Mother is aiming a super-directional microphone at different points on the building.  Whistler listens carefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Second floor, northwest two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Second floor, northwest three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, that's an emergency exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crease is making a diagram as they go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can hear the emergency floodlight batteries recharging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother moves onto another one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it right there.  Crease, what's this mean: "My voice is my passport, verify me?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some sort of voiceprint ID.  I'll check it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I listening to now, Mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Third floor southwest.  Corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, it's bursting with ultrasonic.  I've never heard sensors that powerful before. Bish, someone is very serious about keeping people out of that room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop camouflages a video camera. INT. LIZ'S APARTMENT.  DAY. Mother points out a single lighted window in a time-lapse video of the building.  In the time lapse, dawn breaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, there's the corner room with the motion detectors Whistler heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Cosmo's office.  I saw the sensors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They keep the lights on all night, so we have to assume the sensors are on too.  It won't be easy getting in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, run this on ahead, let's figure out who works next door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl bursts in excitedly.  He's carrying a large, rolled-up blueprint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fascinating what fifty bucks can get you at the county recorder's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have you got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PlayTronics Corporate Headquarters.  The complete blueprints.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not bad.  Not bad, Carl!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you get the fifty bucks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I took it from Mother's wallet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz is on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, mom.  Today's not a good day to come over.  N...No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop walks past her and into her kitchen.  In there, Crease is unpacking a large machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, what have we got here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's called a man-trap.  I borrowed this demo from the manufacturer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a digital voice recognition monitor, hooked up to an access booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NSA uses the same technology to keep people out of restricted areas at Fort Meade. Card?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands Bishop a card.  Bishop swipes it through the machine's card reader.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now speak right into this box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He indicates a speaker-like grille. Bishop reads from the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.  My name is Martin Bishop.  My name is my passport. Verify me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The machine buzzes and replies:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you can't pass through unless your voiceprint matches the one encoded on the card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we need someone's card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And their voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we beat this with tape?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has to be up close and personal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Otherwise you'll be caught in the steel-reinforced booth while the guards with shotguns are called.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's great.  Really great.  What about motion detectors?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm picking one up this afternoon.  That makes beating this look easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Bish.  I think we've found our guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother's video screen shows the Playtronics building with just a few lights left on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I've blown up the image a little. Here's the room next to Cosmo's.  Now it's the end of the day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some lights go out in the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch who comes out.  Let me zoom in on the front door.  A lady in a green skirt, and this guy with the cap. Nobody comes out for another eighteen minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So it's one of those two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.  Now here's the next evening.  Again. The office next to Cosmo's.  The lights go out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy in the cap.  Anybody else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody else comes out for twenty-two minutes.  That's who works next door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.  Okay,  we'll use his office to get into Cosmo's. Can we get plates?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see.  Zooming in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He zooms in on the license plate of the car the guy in the cap got into.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another bump... enhancing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plate comes into clear focus: California plate "180 IQ".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's your plate.  180 IQ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hah.  Cute.  Alright.  Carl?  Let's do this guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crease looks up the guy's Motor Vehicle Report.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His name's Werner Brandes.  Single, 6'1", 174 pounds, must wear glasses to drive, no outstanding tickets or warrants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop looks over surveillance photos of Brandes and his car. With a magnifying glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leaves work between six and seven every night, takes the same route home, he obeys the speed limit and comes to a complete stop at every stop sign, and signals when he changes lanes.  He's a very safe driver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: $750 limit on his Visa, pays his bills, no bad debts, no bum checks.  No registered firearms.  Member, International Microchip Designer's Association and chairman of the social committee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.  The world's most boring human.  How the hell are we going to get close enough to record him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop and Crease are startled by a crashing sound from the kitchen.  It's garbage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Mother!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother walks in carrying two garbage bags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Liz.  Standard procedure.  Trash from the guy's house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And thank you for bringing it into mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sneakers dump the trash out onto the floor and begin sifting through it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, let's see here.  Phone bill, no long distance. Club Med brochure.  Ticket stubs to a Barry Manilow concert. Here it is. Here we go.  "Dear Compu-dater.  Welcome to the world of automated compatibility."  He's a computer dater!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love it!  Let's get him a date!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was the name of that gal that we did... used in the cereal company sneak last year?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandy Krieger?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it.  Married a cop.  How about... Barbara? She was cute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but she'd never do it.  She regards this work as juvenile.  That's why she divorced me. How about your friend Jessie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, she's buff!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fellas, fellas, look at this man's trash! He's not looking for buff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother holds up two neatly folded empty cereal boxes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the nicest garbage I've ever seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man who folded this tube of Crest is looking for someone meticulous, refined. Anal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the sneakers look at her.  She's just described herself wonderfully and hasn't quite noticed yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An asian man is on stage, singing "Bad, Bad Leroy Brown" in Chinese. Liz winds her way through the restaurant to find Brandes.  When she finds him, he is putting in eye drops.  He stands to greet her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Werner?  Hi!  I'm Doris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... hi!  Are you ready for the Dim Sum bar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm not really in any hurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright.  I'll be right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes off.  She sits down and waits.  She checks her hidden microphone and pulls out a notepad.  The notepad has written on it: Hi, my name is Werner Brandes.  My voice is my passport. Verify me. She scratches off "Hi."  Werner returns with a plate of Dim Sum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So.  What an interesting name you have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Werner stuffs a spring roll in his mouth whole, and starts munching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How exactly do you pronounce it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Werner's mouth is full.  He mumbles his reply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muumuu Mammbed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close-up on a high-tech looking motion sensor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is what's in Cosmo's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother enters the room and waves.  The sensor beeps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Best motion sensor on the market.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And watch this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother breathes on the sensor.  It beeps again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Also responds to thermal differentials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does this have a happy ending?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah.  We can wrap you in a full body suit of neoprene heat-resistant rubber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He demonstrates with a neoprene wetsuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or we can raise the temperature in Cosmo's office to 98.6 degrees.  Which is probably what we'll have to do, because the neoprene would suffocate you.  Either way, you've got a top speed of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slowly moves his neoprene-shielded hand across the sensor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...two... inches... per... second... any faster than that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He waves the hand quickly, the sensor beeps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and... big guys with guns. But, you'll probably do fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since when am I the one that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother cuts him off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the same model of answering machine that Janek used for the shell of his box, now that's what you'll be carrying across the floor at two inches per second.  I got that for you because I figured that you'd... you know, just wanna practice with it. Remember to... go real slow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get all the fun stuff!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz has crossed off all the words except "Passport."  A waiter is vacuuming the floor.  This date should have ended a long while ago.  Werner comes back to the table, the waiter says something to him in Chinese.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what about travel?  Where do you like to go?  Europe? Mexico?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, I don't know, I've never been out of the country. Look, I think they want us to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs her arm.  She grabs back and forces him to sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down, Werner. Oh, talk to me.  You know what?  I really love the sound of your voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?  I always thought it was kind of nasal and pinched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His voice IS nasal and pinched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no, not at all, it's lovely.  And, um, there's this one word... I've always loved the sound of this word...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no!  Oh, no, you wouldn't... no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I would, what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, what?  Please.  What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would really... like to hear you say the word... "passport"...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brandes looks confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passport?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz sort of half laughs, half moans with excitement. She kisses him on the cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, you're right, we ought to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, Doris?  Would you like to have breakfast with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shall I phone you or nudge you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz looks around, discomforted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check, please!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whistler is assembling a tape loop of the words Liz got Brandes to say.  It sounds unnatural but seamless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi!  my, name. Is, Werner Brandes.  My. Voice? is my. Passport???  Verify.  me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl, posing as a groundskeeper, prunes a shrub and walks across the parking lot and up to the building. INT. PLAYTRONICS SECURITY BOOTH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that the gardener?  I thought they already left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I use your john, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl walks past an ornery-looking security gate and into the men's room.  He climbs up into a duct above the cieling, and starts crawling around.  Outside, the desk guard notices that he's been in a while.  He goes into the men's room, but it's unoccupied.  He goes back to the desk and starts to make a phone call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, listen, a few minutes ago a gardener came...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He notices a gardener outside raking leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skip it, I see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other gardener is Mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay fellas, I'm out of here.  Carl, have a nice ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl jumps onto the roof of a moving elevator.  He gets off in another shaft, and enters a boiler room.  In the boiler room, he sets a thermotstat.  The temperature display starts rising. INT. BRANDES' HOUSE.  KITCHEN. Brandes is cooking something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooo.  It's hot in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I'll just open this window a little bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes over to a window and opens it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll join you as soon as I'm finished pounding these breasts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz laughs and passes something to Mother, who is waiting outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, the best thing about this meal, besides it's absolutely fabulous, is it only has 400 calories.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, great!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I'm very concerned about what we eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother rifles through Brandes' wallet and finds a card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would you say is the ideal diet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sort of... eat, you know, sort of on the run... You know, I'm really busy, so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother whistles unobtrusively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I'll tell you, the ideal diet - don't laugh - is the bottom of the monkey cage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz takes the wallet back from Mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, what did you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a look at the bottom of the monkey cage.  You have, uh, greens...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone knocks on the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there someone at your door?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not expecting anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brandes checks the front door.  While he's not looking, Liz replaces his wallet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, nobody there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz, Oh, I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're all alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah.  I'll just close the window.  It's okay now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She closes the window.  Brandes goes back to his cooking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but it's true, I read that once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bottom of the monkey cage!  What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have fruit, you have greens, you have...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother drives away. INT. PLAYTRONICS BULDING. A security guard watches a monitor.  The phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good evening, Playtronics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop casually walks up to the security gate.  He swipes Brandes' card through.  The gate lets him through.  A printout shows that Werner Brandes has entered through the front entrance at 8:20 PM on October 26.  Inconvenient time to answer the phone... INT. SNEAKER VAN. Mother is reading a tabloid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cattle mutilations are up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop, now wearing glasses, strides through the corridor.  He enters a stairwell and goes up.  He attaches a small black box to the security camera. INT. SNEAKER VAN. Suddenly, a bank of security monitors in the van light up with pictures from inside the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, here we go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin, we've got video.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whsitler, hit record.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rolling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pictures are coming in fine.  You are clear all the way up to the man-trap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop swipes Brandes' card again and enters the man-trap.  He plays a tape.  It's too fast.  The machine buzzes gently and says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please speak more slowly. Bishop quickly rewinds.  He plays it back normal speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi!  my, name. Is, Werner Brandes.  My. Voice? is my. Passport???  Verify.  me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The machine displays "*** THANK YOU ***" and lets him through. He enters Brandes' office using the card.  A security printout clicks to register the fact.  He empties his briefcase and takes off his tie. INT. BOILER ROOM. The temperature gauge now says 88.1 degrees and rising. INT. BRANDES' OFFICE. Bishop is up in the cieling, now moving over Cosmo's office.  He lifts a panel and looks down.  The sensors, the Cray, the designer wire furniture, and the metal briefcase containing Janek's box are all in plain view. He lowers a sound sensor into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a three foot area in the corner just outside the sensors' range.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.  Hold on.  Whistler?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl, how's the weather?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 98.6 and holding!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beauty.  We got body temp, Crease!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop carefully lowers himself into Cosmo's office, in the area behind the sensors that is out of their range. He starts walking excruciatingly slowly. INT. BRANDES' HOUSE. Liz is looking out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once again, I am so sorry about dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it was really delicious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, I overcooked the carrots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I like them really squishy like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz notices a stuffed toy dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's cute!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brandes lights up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, uh watch.  Watch this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brandes snaps his fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Play dead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The toy dog rolls over onto its back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brandes laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I designed the voice recognition chip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a thing to do.  Could I just make a quick phone call?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, uh, it's in the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Upstairs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, just go upstairs and then you walk straight forward.  And the first one is a closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes.  The toy dog thinks it hears a command: "Walk Straight Forward."  It complies and walks straight forward.  It knock's Liz's purse off the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh pooch.  Look what you've done to Doris' purse!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He picks up the purse, and her wallet which has fallen out.  It opens up to her driver's licence.  He takes a look and realizes that Liz's name is not Doris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop continues to walk painstakingly across the room. INT. BRANDES' BEDROOM. Liz is on the phone, but it's just ringing.  Brandes arrives at the door and knocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Psst.  What do you say we go for a ride... Doris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop is still moving across the room at top speed, 2 inches per second. INT. SNEAKER VAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe it!  Now what are you saying, the NSA killed Kennedy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, they shot him, but they didn't kill him. He's still alive!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it.  I've had it.  I don't want to talk to you anymore.  You just do your job. I don't want to talk to you anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, fine.  It was the same people who framed Pete Rose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brandes is driving to work.  At night.  With Liz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy, this was fun.  Want to go back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no, we're almost there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crease.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no, Crease.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Werner just pulled up.  He's got Liz with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crease gets on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin, I think you'd better hurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one thing I can't do is hurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens the briefcase.  Inside is Janek's answering machine. INT. PLAYTRONICS FRONT DESK. Liz protests incomprehensibly as Brandes drags her to the security guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, I want you to say it for me just one time, "Passport", you have such a beautiful voice!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They reach the guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.  I'm Dr. Brandes, I work up on three, and I believe that this phoney is involved in some kind of plot to break into my office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it, hold it!  Let me see your entry card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brandes doesn't have it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You took my card!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What card?  See, I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They go on arguing, and another security guard behind a booth makes a phone call upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, we have a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrying Janek's box, Bishop inches his way back across the room.  He makes it back to the sensors' blind spot. INT. PLAYTRONICS FRONT DESK. Dick Gordon and Buddy Wallace arrive on the scene.  Liz and Brandes are still arguing with the desk guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...now there is a great idea, call the police!  I'm very sorry to disturb you, but I think that someone is trying to break into my office!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Cosmo shows up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's take a look at his office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop hurriedly puts everything back in his briefcase. INT. STAIRWELL. Cosmo, Gordon, Liz, Wallace, and Brandes make their way upstairs. INT. BRANDES' OFFICE. Bishop grabs his briefcase and goes back up inside the cieling. INT. PLAYTRONICS CORRIDOR. Cosmo uses a remote control to completely bypass the man-trap. All five walk through.  They arrive at Brandes' office and hit the lights.  Bishop has *just* made it.  Brandes looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, uh, everything seems to be in order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yessir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're very sorry to have troubled you, miss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not as sorry as I am, Werner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're letting her go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll call you a cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.  This is my last computer date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cosmo thinks about this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait.  A computer matched her with him?  I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon and Wallace start back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He runs back to his own office, using his remote control to enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is it so hot in here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He runs to his desk and opens the metal briefcase.  It is empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARTY!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole complex goes into a full scale security lockdown. Floodlights light, alarms wail. Armed men pour in from out of nowhere. INT. SNEAKER VAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin, we've got six guards in the front lobby, four in the south corridor, second floor, five upstairs north.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guards in the boiler room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God. Carl, listen carefully. You've got trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother opens the blueprint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heating ducts, over the furnace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll be alright.  Just find the heating ducts above the furnace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'll get him to the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That will lead you to the elevator chasm. Martin, there's a fire escape at the end of the north corridor.  You'll have to break through a couple of firewalls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have him go south.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  Go directly north!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's an air duct there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Directly north about thirty yards!  Once you're there, let me know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dick Gordon and Cosmo oversee the sweep for Bishop and Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue team, move to southwest corridor one. Green team, secure north corridor three. White team, secure all exits...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll be in a crawl space.  Break through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two guards with shotguns comply. INT. CIELING CRAWLSPACE. A guard climbs up into a cieling crawlspace and looks around. Bishop gets out of his sight just in time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crease, I'm in Northeast 3 over the corridor.  I think it's a dead end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't move.  And don't worry, we'll get you out of there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whistler, we've got guards in every stairwell.  Can you hear if there's any...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother notices that a guard has found their video transmitter. The guard abruptly yanks it.  All the monitors go blank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  Don't say "Oh, no."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buddy Wallace strolls down the corridor carrying a mean-looking shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Wallace, I'm in Northeast 3, going to check it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop hears him below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin, we've lost pictures...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the quiet, the noise of Bishop's earpiece can be heard by Wallace.  Bishop desperately tries to cover it up but it's too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DO YOU READ ME??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wallace smiles, he knows he has Bishop cornered.  He shoots into the cieling.  And again.  And again.  And again.  His fourth shot barely misses Bishop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop shooting.  Marty?  I know you are in the building, and I know you can hear me. Whoo, God.  You should not have come back, Marty.  I won, you lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cosmo's voice echoes throughout the entire building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if our friendship had meant anything to you at all, that's the way you should have left it, but you always had to be the one to win, didn't you?  You're the one who got away with things while I never did.  You always had to get the girl, didn't you?  So I never did.  At least not until now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz looks on from a wire couch in Cosmo's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's lovely, Marty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop gasps, astonished and fearful. INT. COSMO'S OFFICE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Marty, please bring me the box.  You must come. I will never let either of you live if you try to get out.  I am your way out.  I'm your only way out.  If I wanted you dead, you would be dead.  Marty, I cannot kill you.  I cannot kill you. You have to trust me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys, I'm going in.  You hear me, Carl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop pulls a cieling panel aside.  Below is Wallace, ready to blow him away. INT. COSMO'S OFFICE. Wallace leads Bishop in at gunpoint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.  How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop just sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you have my box?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a deal, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cosmo starts to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a second.  Wait a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dick Gordon loads his pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamnit, you gave me your word!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I cannot kill my friend. Kill my friend!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't really think we were gonna let you go, did you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't really think I was going to let you have this box, did you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now?  What are you talking about, "Now?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn right, now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wallace and Gordon take aim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl, now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl leaps through the cieling panel and lands squarely on Gordon, knocking him down.  In the split second of distraction, Bishop grabs Wallace's shotgun.  Liz screams.  The two men struggle.  Liz picks up Gordon's pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go of him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She fires a shot into the cieling.  Wallace and Bishop stop struggling.  She's shaking and hyperventilating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean it!  I'm an excellent marksman... woman...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wallace puts his hands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh sure, sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop takes the gun from Liz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wallace slowly complies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeeeeoooou...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop smacks Wallace squarely in the jaw with the gun. Wallace falls, out cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl, what the hell were you waiting for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not easy, what I just did!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys, can we get out of here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three run to a stairwell and go up. EXT. PLAYTRONICS ROOF.  NIGHT. Bishop, Carl, and Liz run across the roof, dodging spotlights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crease, we're on the roof.  There's a fire escape on the north side.  Is it clear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three reach the fire escape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a hill overlooking the northeast corner of the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van's headlights flash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beautiful, come and get us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl and Liz go down the fire escape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And hurry up, we've only got a few minutes before anybody knows we're gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crease and Mother go up front.  Mother starts the van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming to get you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two guards appear, weapons drawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put your hands where I can see them and step out of the van. You too, midnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whistler, still in the back of the van, puts on a radio headset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bish... they've got Crease and Mother!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! Whistler, you've gotta do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've gotta drive.  I'll talk you through it.  Now hurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: D-Drive what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guards frisk Crease and Mother.  Whistler comes up to the driver's seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Bish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, there's a gate about thirty yards behind you.  Put it in reverse and floor it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I ever tell you why I had to leave the CIA?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, what's reverse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, one down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My temper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whistler floors it in reverse.  The van takes off.  In the split second of distraction, Crease overpowers both guards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Motherfuckers mess with me, I'll split your heads!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, Crease, where's Whistler going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, Bish?  I'm going backwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're doing fine... you're doing fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van, going backwards, breaks through a gate. Whistler yells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, hit the brakes, now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van screeches to a halt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Whistler, put the gear shift down two notches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whistler shifts gears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn left, floor it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Straighten out, straighten out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van straightens out.  It jumps curbs and grassy islands in the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What... what was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, keep coming...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God, I'm driving.  I'm driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van continues to jump curbs across the parking lot. Whistler covers his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no, don't do that, I'm driving!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whistler is coming up on some cars now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, whoa, whoa, go left... uh... my left! Right! Right, right!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop is too late. Whistler hits two cars, which spin out of the way.  The van keeps going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's... it's okay.  Beautiful, now keep coming.  Keep coming.  Now, you're going to go down a very... gentle slope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, okay, fine, great.  No problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The "slope" is not at all gentle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoo-oa!  Oh boy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  Five more seconds, then stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van crashes into a wall.  Whistler's headset is knocked off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'll stop right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz and Carl run to the van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whistler, that was great!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whistler!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no, I'm taking the wheel.  In the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother and Crease run up to the van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Martin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop starts down the fire escape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cosmo aims a gun at Bishop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you step away from the ladder?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will give me the box right now, or I will kill you, right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cosmo fires.  He just misses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just give me the box, Marty!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you couldn't kill your friend, Cos!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I missed on purpose, now give me the box!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take the goddamn thing!  I don't want it! You win, I lose, that's what you want, isn't it?  Say it.  Say it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YES!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop gives Cosmo the box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Cos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could have shared this with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could have had the power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you know the places we can go with this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I do.  There's nobody there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly!  The world isn't run by weapons anymore, or energy, or money, it's run by little ones and zeroes, little bits of data. It's all just electrons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't expect other people to understand this, but I do expect YOU to understand this!  We started this journey together!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't a "journey", Cos.  It was a prank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a war out there, old friend, a world war.  And it's not about who's got the most bullets, it's about who controls the information.  What we see and hear, how we work, what we think, it's all about the information!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I were you, I'd destroy that thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop starts down the ladder again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cosmo again takes aim at Bishop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do what you have to do, Cos, but if you want to stop me, you'll have to pull the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop continues down the ladder.  Cosmo lets him. Cosmo looks inside the box.  It is empty!  He's astonished.  Meanwhile, the van speeds away. INT. SNEAKER VAN. As they drive back to the office, Bishop opens the REAL box. The codebreaker chip is still inside. INT. MARTIN BISHOP & ASSOCIATES OFFICES.  NIGHT. The sneakers return to the office for the first time in days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe we actually made it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe that we pulled off the greatest sneak in history and we can't tell anybody about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I can't believe?  I can't believe tomorrow's Thursday!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone else turns on a light.  He aims his gun at Mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not one word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A female NSA agent with a submachine gun appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, all of you, step over here.  Hands over your heads.  Move!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The agents herd the sneakers up against the wall of the conference room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Bishop.  I'm Bernard Abbott.  National Security Agency.  We spoke on the phone.  I believe you have something that belongs to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's interesting, don't you think, you guys? That the NSA is here?  I thought the FBI was supposed to do this kind of thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely.  This is outside the NSA's jurisdiction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless the NSA didn't want anybody to know about Janek's little black box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I keep thinking about something Greg told me.  He said that our codes were based on an entirely different system than the Russian codes.  So this box really wouldn't work on them. The only thing it would really be good for is spying on Americans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, sure, with a box like that, they could read the FBI's mail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or the CIA's. Or the White House's!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No wonder they don't want to share with the other children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want, Mr. Bishop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clear up my record.  Get out of my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have much choice, do I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not unless you want to read about it in Newsweek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deal.  The box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not so fast.  I want a Winnebago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fully equipped.  Big kitchen.  Waterbed. AM/FM CD. Microwave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not a car dealership, pal!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants a Winnebago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright.  A Winnebago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.  Burgundy interior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now the box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crease clears his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, I have never taken my wife to Europe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry to hear it. Give me the box!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will buy me two round trip first class tickets to Athens, Lisbon, Madrid, and Scotland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't forget Tahiti.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Tahiti.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tahiti is not in Europe!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, when you get the box, you can give us geography lessons, until then, this man goes to Tahiti.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.  Tahiti!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl walks up to Abbott and speaks quietly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The young lady with the... ...Uzi.  Is she... single?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, you know, Carl... Excuse us please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop takes Carl aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the brass ring.  Now, you've got to think bigger thoughts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want her telephone number.  Please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The young woman lowers her weapon, amazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about a lunch?  You can chaperone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  I will not do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Abbie. Abbie, come on, now the FBI would give him twins!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a second.  You can have anything you want, and you're asking for my phone number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Mary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to be sick!  Are we done here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not yet.  Whistler?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whistler walks out into the middle of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want peace on earth and goodwill toward men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, this is ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want peace on earth and goodwill toward men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are the United States Government.  We don't do that sort of thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're just going to have to try.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright!  I'll see what I can do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you very much. That's all I ask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about you?  What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles sweetly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I have the box?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop gives him the box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know it doesn't work.  It never did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not important, is it?  What's really important is that none of this ever happened.  This box doesn't exist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never saw it before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abbott and the agents leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop.  All you did was say it was broken. Can't they still just hook it up and do terrible things with it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop shows her Janek's chip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a surprise announcement, the Republican National Committee has revealed it is bankrupt!  A spokesman for the party said they had plenty of money in their accounts last week, but today they just don't know where the money has gone. But not everybody's going begging.  Amnesty International, Greenpeace, and the United Negro College Fund announced record earnings this week, due mostly to large, anonymous donations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The credits roll. PRODUCTION MANAGER Lindsley Parsons, Jr. FIRST ASSISTANT DIRECTOR William M. Elvin

dialogues.text: ART DEPT. COORDINATOR  Beth Bernstein PRODUCTION ILLUSTRATORS  Thomas W. Lay, Jr. LEADMAN  David C. Potter BUYER  Andrea Mae Fenton 2ND LEADMAN  Tommy Samona SWING  Mike Sweeny

Clark STANDBY PAINTER  Robert Stephen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
